page.title: 11Farming in the Area
page.content: Anacre Hill Farm, Snelston is a 54 acre all grass dairy farm and is farmed by the owners Dorothy and Gordon Grindey. The house and buildings are very old but have been modernised as far as possible, enabling the owners to do the farming themselves, apart from having a contractor to make "Big Bale Silage" for winter feed. The stock consists of 47 Guernsey cows which are tied up and milked by pipeline into a bulk tank and 24 followers of different ages. It is by fertilizing and reseeding that they are able to keep that amount of stock. Also they rent some ground in another parish from which they get some hay. Recently there has been a change in the pig enterprise, 20 breeding sows have been sold, and they are buying weaners to fatten instead (less work).
